abstract: Laurence D. Fink is being bandied about as one of the top candidates to succeed E. Stanley O’Neal as head of Merrill Lynch. He would bring a strong track record as the leader of BlackRock, the asset management firm he founded in 1988 and merged with Merrill’s asset management arm in 2006, as well as blend of banking and trading acumen.
lead_paragraph: Laurence D. Fink is being bandied about as one of the top candidates to succeed E. Stanley O’Neal as head of Merrill Lynch. He would bring a strong track record as the leader of BlackRock, the asset management firm he founded in 1988 and merged with Merrill’s asset management arm in 2006, as well as blend of banking and trading acumen.
